Name: Upper Part of a Statue of Aphrodite
Description: The face of this statue of Aphrodite, a Greek goddess, is sculpted with the delicate facial features of Roman art, which is obvious in all of her statues. She is naked and the arms and legs of the statue are broken. Her head is slightly inclined to the left and her hair is parted in the middle and fastened behind. She is wearing a hair band with a small knot in the front and her ears are pierced for earrings.
